sense.name: the act of terminating a life
sense.examples: The mob ordered a hit man from Florida to make the kill. The shrieking noises were probably a raccoon in the midst of a kill.

sense.name: the destruction of enemy during combat
sense.examples: The pilot scored three kills during the aerial combat training session. Johnny shot his laser at the monster for another kill in the video game.

sense.name: a slain animal hunted and caught by another
sense.examples: The lions hunched around the kill, a young zebra, and devoured the flesh. My cat brought her latest kill into the living room and presented it to me.

sense.name: a decisive shot in sports that cannot be returned by the opponent
sense.examples: The tennis star made another kill as he smashed the ball just over the net. Our volleyball team made a great kill that ended the last volley.

sense.name: benefit from the successful conclusion of an enterprise
sense.examples: The two brothers were in on the kill from the bank robbery. (got some money) Mary is a founder and was in on the kill when their stock went public.

sense.name: make a decisive, concluding action
sense.examples: The chess master closed in for the kill by moving his queen to check the king. John noted the fallacy of the debater's argument and proceeded to close in for the kill with his rebuttal.
